title: Xukuru language
text:
Xukuru (Xucuru, Shukurú, Ichikile) is an extinct and poorly attested language of Brazil. It is also known as "Kirirí, Kirirí-Xokó, Ichikile". It is known only from a few word lists and a sketch by <a href="Geraldo%20Lapenda">Geraldo Lapenda</a> (1962).
It was originally spoken in the Serra de São José and on the <a href="Do%20Meio%20River%20%28Para%C3%ADba%29">Meio River</a>, <a href="Capibaribe%20River">Capibaribe River</a> and <a href="Taperoa%20River">Taperoa River</a> in the states of <a href="Pernambuco">Pernambuco</a> and <a href="Para%C3%ADba">Paraíba</a>. Loukotka (1968) reports the most recent locations as the and <a href="Cimbres">Cimbres</a>.
Classification.
Loukotka (1968) considers Xukuru to form a <a href="Xukuru%20languages">small family</a> with <a href="Parati%C3%B3%20language">Paratió</a>.
Other languages with this name.
"Xukuru-Kariri" is a variety of <a href="Xok%C3%B3%20language">Xokó</a>, which may be a <a href="Kariri%20languages">Kariri language</a>. The name "Kiriri" is shared by <a href="Dzubuku%C3%A1%20language">Dzubukuá</a>, another Kariri language, and by <a href="Katembri%20language">Katembri</a>. The name "Kiriri-Xoko" is shared with yet another variety of Xokó.
Distribution.
<a href="Geraldo%20Lapenda">Geraldo Lapenda</a> (1962) reported that the Xukuru people can be found primarily in the settlements of Canabrava and <a href="Brejinho">Brejinho</a> in the "aldeia" of <a href="Cimbres">Cimbres</a>, <a href="Pesqueira%2C%20Pernambuco">Pesqueira</a> municipality. They can also be found in the settlements of <a href="Cajueiro">Cajueiro</a>, Ipanema Velho, Caldeirão, Jitó, Lagoa, Machado, Sitio do Meio, Riacho dos Afetos, Trincheiras, Bem-te-vi, Santana, and São José. Although the Xukuru traditionally occupied the <a href="Serra%20do%20Ororob%C3%A1">Serra do Ororobá</a>, they could also be found in other municipalities of <a href="Pernambuco">Pernambuco</a>, namely <a href="Caruaru">Caruaru</a>, <a href="Brejo%20da%20Madre%20de%20Deus">Brejo da Madre de Deus</a>, <a href="Belo%20Jardim">Belo Jardim</a>, <a href="Sanhar%C3%B3">Sanharó</a>, <a href="Po%C3%A7%C3%A3o">Poção</a>, <a href="Pesqueira%2C%20Pernambuco">Pesqueira</a>, and <a href="Arcoverde">Arcoverde</a>.

Morphology.
Common suffixes in Xukuru include -go, which forms verbs, adjectives, and nouns, and -men, of uncertain meaning.
